summary: Cast: Robert Downey Jr., Chris Evans, Mark Ruffalo, Chris Hemsworth, Scarlett Johansson,  Jeremy Renner, Don Cheadle, Paul Rudd,...
body:
Cast: Robert Downey Jr., Chris Evans, Mark Ruffalo, Chris Hemsworth, Scarlett Johansson,  Jeremy Renner, Don Cheadle, Paul Rudd, Benedict Cumberbatch, Chadwick Boseman,  Brie Larson, Tom Holland, Karen Gillan,  Zoe Saldana, Evangeline Lilly

Director: Anthony Russo, Joe Russo

Genre: Action, Adventure, Fantasy, Sci-Fi

Synopsis: After the devastating events of Avengers: Infinity War and the grave course of events set in motion by Thanos that wiped out half the universe and fractured the Avengers, the universe is in ruins. With the help of remaining allies, the Avengers assemble once more to take one final stand and undo Thanos’ actions in the hopes of restoring order to the universe. Marvel Studios’ grand conclusion to twenty-two films, Avengers: Endgame.

Review: One word: INCREDIBLE! This was the big one, the end of an era so it was only logical that it would go all out in satisfying our appetite for a grand cinematic masterpiece. As a huge fan of the Marvel, my journey started with the first movie (Iron Man) of the MCU franchise 11 years ago and never would I have guessed that 21 movies later, I would still be here; still equally excited by every MCU movie released in what has been an amazing roller-coaster ride on a wave of cinematic excellence. Endgame was the final chapter and what a final chapter it was. Normally, there is a saying that the higher the expectation for a movie, the higher the probability of it being a disappointment well Marvel has now debunked this myth twice, first with Infinity War and now with Endgame.

Endgame focuses on the events following Thanos’ actions on earth and the effects those actions had on the surviving members of the Avengers. It also centers on the Avengers final plans in undoing the havoc caused by the big bad himself and the restoration of order in a grieving earth. This movie had everything; great acting performances from all the characters, great utilization of CGI’s (safe to say that the MCU has mastered the act of CGI-ing) and an amazing storyline. Endgame was/is an absolute perfection all things superhero movies considered. It was a truly epic and perfect ending to a long journey of marvel movies. There are rarely movie franchises that consistently deliver like the MCU so it was no surprise that Endgame would surpass my expectations.

Endgame more than lived up to the hype: a thrilling conclusion and a deeply emotional exploration of loss and love, duty and honor, friendship and family. I grew up with the marvel universe and I have to say this is the most perfect send-off for the most perfect franchise of all time. My only complaint about Endgame is that it raises the bar so high that there may never be a superhero movie that can match it (although Infinity War comes quite close). Endgame is for me; the best superhero movie I have ever watched. That being said, you know what to do if you haven’t seen it yet.

Rating: 9.5/10

blog.name: gazumbo
blog.title: Fiction is My Dearest Friend
blog.description: 19, gal, Aussie. Far too emotionally invested in people who aren't real. Mostly shows I'm in to; Agents of Shield, GoT, The 100, The Walking Dead, DC and Marvel/comic book adaptions, so much more... OTPs are my Kryptonite. Art Blog: "idontlikecheesethatmuch"

body:
***AVENGERS: END GAME SPOILERS***





Opinion: Steve Rogers should have died, finally moving on from a world that wasn’t his, and Tony Stark should have lived, settling down for good to raise his daughter in peace.

Tony’s death was poetic and wrapped his arc up perfectly, and I understand RDJ wanted a sure and sound end to his part in the MCU, but Cap going off to live a life with Peggy was, while beautiful, not “moving on” as he strived to do, and in a way, the tragedy of his lost time was always part of what made him Captain America. Sacrificing himself would have been a devastating yet beautiful way to show that as much as he wanted to, he couldn’t move on from Peggy, and that to live in a world without her and without Nat, arguably the two most important women in his life, would have been too painful. It would have brought his story to end in a way that honoured both his beginnings and those he met along the way, allowing him to finally be at peace, which is something he deserved.

The fact that Tony can never watch his daughter grow up is gut-wrenching and I know his death was perfect and incredible and beautiful, and the film needed a tragic end in some way, because it’s the end of the first gen Avengers, but Steve’s deaths would have done that equally as well.

Also the loop holes created from Steve going back to Peggy, effectively erasing her life with her other husband (Daniel Souza for those who didn’t watch Agent Carter) and their children sort of brings the film down in a lot of ways. I know there are other loop holes but that’s a doozy.


Opinions?

summary: On Avengers: Endgame and Infinity War
title: On Avengers: Endgame and Infinity War
body:
On Avengers: Endgame and Infinity War

Avengers: Endgame has broken a fuckton of box office records and frankly everyone is ranting and raving about how awesome it is. Mostly because Avengers: Endgame was awesome but also because it was super hyped up and it did actually meet a lot of people’s expectations, and it also closes off a chapter of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, which has spanned over 10 years.

But for me, something feels…

View On WordPress

blog.name: blackcatangel
blog.title: Black-Cat-Angel
blog.description:
Hi! This is my personal blog where I mainly post stuff like art and craft related to my beloved fandoms. I'm a beginner cosplayer, so you'll see some cosplay photos here as well. I also have an additional cosplay blog.

At the moment I'm mostly posting Once-ler and Homestuck related things. I warn you :D


If you're interested in movies like “The Lorax”, “Horton Hears a Who!” and “How the Grinch Stole Christmas” then feel free to visit Drseuss-fanclub blog which runs by me and my friend Ren is a freebird.

summary: Y’ALL, I THOUGHT CHRIS EVANS WAS MARRIED
title: Y’ALL, I THOUGHT CHRIS EVANS WAS MARRIED
body:
I’m not even kidding, I thought he was already married. You have no idea how shock I was when I first saw this. Like, this guy??? Single??? Pfff, no way!

But seriously, how is a sweetheart like him single? This doesn’t make sense

reblog.comment:

trail.content_raw:
I’m not even kidding, I thought he was already married. You have no idea how shock I was when I first saw this. Like, this guy??? Single??? Pfff, no way!

But seriously, how is a sweetheart like him single? This doesn’t make sense

summary: In GOTG3 I want Nebula to remember Tony
body:
In GOTG3 I want Nebula to remember Tony

Nothing dramatic, just small talk about a game he taught her, mentions about visiting Pepper and Morgan or Rocket and her reminiscing about time in Earth
